steps.title: Surround text with [b] [/b] to make it bold.
steps.content: Surround text with [b] [/b] to make it bold. Any text between the [b] and [/b] will appear in strong bold letters once you post your message. For example, typing [b]wikiHow[/b] will make the word wikiHow bold.

steps.title: Surround text with [i] [/i] italicize the selection.
steps.content: Surround text with [i] [/i] italicize the selection. Again, make sure you place [i] at the beginning of the text, and [/i] at the end.

steps.title: Use [u] [/u] to underline any string of text.
steps.content: Use [u] [/u] to underline any string of text. All text between these two tags will have a single underline.

steps.title: Place text between [s] and [/s] to cross it out.
steps.content: Place text between [s] and [/s] to cross it out. This puts a single line through the text, generally used to suggest that something is no longer applicable.

steps.title: The "color" and "size" tags work a little differently.
steps.content: The "color" and "size" tags work a little differently. With these bb codes, you'll specify a color or font size to customize the text between the tags. The color tag takes both color names and hex codes. You'll use it like this: color="red"]this text will be red[/color] . In the citations, there are links which have lists of colors. [size="number"] text here will be the 3 points [/size]

steps.title: The image tag follows the format [img=http://www.LinkGoesHere.com/images/example.jpg] Just replace the sample link with the location of the photo on the web.
steps.content: The image tag follows the format [img=http://www.LinkGoesHere.com/images/example.jpg] Just replace the sample link with the location of the photo on the web. This displays the image within your post. Get an image's location on a site by right-clicking and selecting Properties, then copying the "Image Location". Depending on the browser, the same function can be done by right-clicking and selecting "Copy Image URL".

steps.title: You'll use the [url] tag to create a hyperlink to a site on the web.
steps.content: You'll use the [url] tag to create a hyperlink to a site on the web. For example, [url= http://www.google.com ]my own link text[/url] would create a link to Google. When a reader clicks my own link text , they'll go to Google.com.

steps.title: Surround the text you want to quote with [quote] [/quote] tags.
steps.content: Surround the text you want to quote with [quote] [/quote] tags. All text within the quote tags will appear in your message in italics. Most forums have a Quote button hat you can click to instantly quote another user. You'll rarely have to enter this code yourself.
